verb.description: Achieve the desired aim or result.
examples: he succeeded in winning a pardon
a mission which could not possibly succeed

verb.description: Take over a throne, inheritance, office, or other position from.
examples: he would succeed Hawke as Prime Minister

phrases: After all, if it works, and nothing succeeds like success, go with the flow.
You know that saying, nothing succeeds like success?
Well, its an old saying and a true one: nothing succeeds like success.
She is a pioneer in the business, she put out a great magazine, and nothing succeeds like success.
But in America, nothing succeeds like success.
origin: Late Middle English: from Old French succeder or Latin succedere come close after, from sub- close to + cedere go.
